helles.title: Helles
helles.description: The Swiss army knife of beers: clean, balanced, and always polite. Gentle malt sweetness keeps it smooth while the subtle bitterness lets every conversation flow. Ideal when you want a beer that simply behaves.

ipa.title: IPA
ipa.description: For everyone who wants to nudge their tastebuds—citrus and pine, bold hops and an honest bitterness to keep you awake. A modern classic brewed with an extra hop bill.

weizen.title: Weizen
weizen.description: The banana-and-clove smoothie that became beer. Light, approachable, and so silky it almost apologises. Perfect when you want a beer without overthinking it.

brewery.title: Our Brewery
brewery.description: In the heart of Andermatt we blend traditional craft with modern technique. Our beers mirror the clarity of the Alps—brewed by hand, rooted in the region, and open to curious visitors.

hero.title:
Modern brewhouse & technology
for hop-forward excellence
hero.description: Over 30 years of homebrewing—a passion now scaled into a brewery. High in the Ursern Alps we brew characterful beers in small batches.

cans.title: Why cans? Easy.
cans.intro: Cans are the most underrated upgrade in craft beer. They’re better for the planet and better for your beer—full stop.

sustainability.title: Sustainability
sustainability.point1: Closed-loop advantage: Cans contain 3×–20× more recycled content than bottles and benefit from efficient return systems (Craft Brewing Business).
sustainability.point2: Less energy: Recycled aluminium saves up to 95 % energy compared with primary production (Wikipedia).
sustainability.point3: Lower emissions: Lifecycle studies show cans emit less CO₂ per litre than glass (Aluminum Association).
sustainability.point4: Proven recovery: 90 % of cans in Switzerland are recycled (NomOQ).

quality.title: Quality & Freshness
quality.point1: No light strike: Cans block UV completely—no skunky off-notes (The Drinks Project).
quality.point2: Less oxygen: Modern filling lines cut oxygen pickup compared with bottles (Cheer Glass).
quality.point3: Chills faster: Aluminium cools quickly—perfect for everyday moments (Food & Wine).
quality.point4: Welcome everywhere: Cans go where glass is banned—with zero breakage risk (The Drinks Project).

cans.closer: Bottles feel nostalgic, but if you care about flavour stability and footprint, cans win. That’s why we package our core beers on site within hours of release.

mash.title: Milling & Mashing
mash.description: Swiss and selected EU malts with multi-step rests for body, fermentability, and style-specific profiles.

boil.title: Boil & Hops
boil.description: Clean bitterness and expressive late additions—from noble classics to modern aroma cultivars.

package.title: Ferment & Package
package.description: Temperature-controlled fermentation followed by on-site canning or kegging—freshness guaranteed.

consistency.title: Consistency without compromise
consistency.description: An automated brewhouse dials in temperatures, timings, and transfers. The craft stays where it belongs: recipe, ingredients, and sensory work. Every batch tastes as planned.

water.title: Andermatt water: Blank canvas
water.description: Our alpine water is naturally soft—ideal for brewing. We tailor minerals (Ca, Mg, Cl⁻, SO₄²⁻) for each style, building the perfect profile from the start.
